summary: The SAFE Lending Act of 2025 aims to amend the Truth in Lending Act and the Electronic Fund Transfer Act to protect consumers. Key provisions include: limiting remotely created checks, outlining consumer protections for electronic fund transfers, requiring registration for small-dollar lenders, prohibiting certain fees on prepaid accounts, and restricting lead generation in small-dollar credit transactions. It also mandates a study on the availability of capital on tribal reservations and directs the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection to create necessary rules.
